column4: Hi all, I have a query. I had a FAT32 partition that was shared between my Windows and Ubuntu installation. It was showing up in Ubuntu as 12 GB filesystem. But suddenly it now shows its name as æ±». Any clues on whysuch a thing has happened and how to correct it?
not sure, but you probably don't really need a FAT32 anymore, because Ubuntu can deal with NTFS read and write stabley since 7.10, and yeah other distros can do NTFS like this as well of course
and NTFS is also quite a bit better than FAT32

ideally  Linux file systems, but those aren't so easy to use with Windows as well
